title: Mathematics Instructional Material Design Utilizing Cognitive Load Theory and Multimedia Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and experience with online learning tools
context.additional_context: Case-based design to strengthen job relevance for in-service professionals, incorporating real-time interaction and digital resource utilization.

learning_goals: Learners can optimize information presentation methods when explaining mathematical concepts by applying cognitive load theory.
Learners develop the ability to design integrated visual and auditory materials according to multimedia learning principles.
Learners can develop customized instructional materials considering learners' prior knowledge and motivation.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
